et: Middle English, borrowed from Anglo-French, borrowed from Latin {it}occident-, occidens{/it} "the part of the sky where the sun sets, the west," noun derivative of present participle of {it}occidere{/it} "to be struck down, die, sink below the horizon (of the sun or other heavenly bodies)," from {it}oc-,{/it} assimilated variant of {it}ob-{/it} {et_link|ob-|ob-} + {it}cadere{/it} "to fall" {ma}{mat|chance:1|}{/ma}

shortdef: the western areas of the world; especially : Europe and America
